dk.aau.cs.giraf.savannah.serverConnection

Class TransmissionHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • dk.aau.cs.giraf.savannah.serverConnection.TransmissionHandler

  • public class TransmissionHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    When this object is constructed it calls a method that will begin to deconstruct the InputStream data. 
     Format:
        Ping:           TYPE[int]PING[size]="randomBytes"
                int             = int, CRUD value
                size    = int, size of the random bytes
 
        Request:        TYPE[int1]MXML[length,int2]="xmlData"[ACCEPT]
                int1    = int, CRUD value
                length  = int, length of xmlData
                int2    = boolean, any files comming ? False for Request
 
        COMMIT:         TYPE[int1]MXML[length,int2]="xmlData"FILE[length2,name.ext,int3]="fileData"[ACCEPT]
                int1    = int, CRUD value
                length  = int, length of xmlData
                int2    = boolean, any files comming ? False if last file.
                length2 = long, size of file
                name.ext        = String, name and extension of file
                int3    = boolean, any files comming ?
 
            TYPE[int]
                - int = has 10 cell spaces allocated
 
        MXML[length,int]
                - length = has 10 cell spaces allocated
                - int = has 1 cell space allocated
 
        FILE[length,name.ext,int]
                - length = has 19 cell spaces allocated
                - name.ext = has 256 cell spaces allocated
                - int = has 1 cell space allocated
    Author:
    Thorbjørn Kvist Nielsen

    • Constructor Detail

      • TransmissionHandler

        public TransmissionHandler(java.net.Socket socket,
                   java.lang.String folder)
                    throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                           java.io.IOException,
                           java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Constructs a TransmissionHandler from the specified arguments.
        Parameters:
        socket - - the Socket used to connect to the Server.
        folder - - the folder used to stored received files.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - - If the files received could not be written to the HDD.
        java.io.IOException - - If the internal Socket could not connect. If the transmission cannot be receive from the Server. If the files received could not be written to the HDD.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - - If the data in the InputStream does not conform with the defined transmission format.

    • Method Detail

      • getPING

        public int getPING()
        Returns:
        The amount of data used in the Ping. Returns -1 unless a Ping is received.

      • getCRUD

        public CRUD getCRUD()
        Returns:
        The CRUD value of the transmission.

      • getXML

        public java.lang.String getXML()
        Returns:
        The xml contained in the transmission. Returns an empty String, if a Ping is received.

      • getFILES

        public java.util.List<java.io.File> getFILES()
        Returns:
        A list of File objects which were transfered. Returns an empty list, if a Ping is received.

      • getAnyFiles

        public boolean getAnyFiles()
        Returns:
        True if any files were transfered, otherwise it returns false.

      • getAccepted

        public boolean getAccepted()
        Returns:
        True, if a transmission is received. Returns false if a Ping is received.
